intro: Solanum amblycalycinum, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a perennial shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces small, yellow berries that are edible when ripe but contain toxic alkaloids when unripe. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
